Land was gorgeous, record player was such a quaint and fun touch, and we loved the kitty cats!
David was an absolute delight. Available to chit chat casually or whenever needed, but also keeps to himself just the perfect amount. I overall felt very at home! My only critique, or suggestion, is that this is the kind of stay best suited for people with a bit of a stricter schedule for the duration of their bnb stay. Strictly enforced quiet hours for half the day, 10 PM-9AM, David’s wife unlocking and opening the door at 7 AM, 4 hours before check out, because she mistakenly thought we had left ? even though we had expressed nothing of the sort and our car was still fully out in the open and parked in her driveway as it had been all along. My fiancé and I are very generally easy going, kind, and respectful guests, albeit we can get a tad lax sometimes. I feel this bnb would be suited for folks that sleep early & value structure.

review_text: Wow! Where do I even start! I guess I’ll start by saying the pictures DO NOT do this place justice! Pulling up and seeing the house at first glance for the first time set back from the road with all these absolutely breathtaking oak trees is a site to behold…. As I pulled into the gravel driveway, I was greeted by an oversized and great outdoor entertaining area that was beautifully lit with the hanging patio lights (which is adjustable by remote) ❤️ The host took the time to put those on as he knew I would be coming in a dusk. Heck I’m was extremely smooth and he had the key waiting for me to easily get in and enjoy the home, relax and rest.. as he checked in I asked about the fireplaces and he quickly came over to show me how to work each fireplace, how to work the Apple TV and also shared the amazing historical memories and genealogy of all the generations before him which I really enjoyed… once he left I didn’t leave the red room in front of the fireplace for quite some time until my food arrived which I picked up from the front porch :) I quickly realized I somehow locked myself out of the house and the host quickly came by to let me back in the house and also moved the chaise lounge in front of the fireplace so that I was extra comfy! Between the The master bedroom and the study… I did open that door and keep open to allow for easy passage of the two and so that I can get to the master bathroom without having to go out into the foyer/hallway area… just a small suggestion for anyone who maybe staying in the future ;-) there is pretty much every single thing you need in order to eat and cook and even grill… all you need are the things you are cooking but utensils, seasonings kitchen gadgets etc… there is no need! Oh speaking of everything you need! When the host came to set up the fireplaces he graciously brought over some red wine which me and my gf’s will be enjoying once they arrive tomorrow! Every room here has its own theme… it’s own story… I constantly get up at times and explore the house and find new things each time… I still have not figured out where the chaise lounge came from as I never did find a space amongst all the furniture of where it could have possibly came from? Lol… it is tastefully decorated and very homey… I have not felt this relaxed in such a while! I was able to read, pray, reflect, meditate, be still, sleep and rest for the first couple of days on my own… then have some amazing quality time with my husband and kids as they came up on evening 2 for a night and we all enjoyed our special time together, they left earlier today as I write this and get to have quiet time again…. Then tomorrow I have some of my closest friends joining me until Thursday morning for our ladies retreat/staycation! I say all that to say this home is diverse and fitting for any and all uses whether it’s alone…. With family…. As a romantic getaways… a group of friends… or even a wedding… it’s absolutely perfect for any situation and I look forward to continuing my stay here and already can’t wait to return and make this quick and close by RETREAT SPOT a recurring thing and a place to visit and recharge! Huge shout out and thanks to the hosts again for allowing me to stay!

My experience with Jonathan at Bellevue Manor was amazing! My husband and I choose Bellevue Manor as our wedding venue.

As an Airbnb rental, Bellevue Manor was an amazing choice. We rented the house for 4 days and slept 10 comfortably. The unique house was filled with beautiful antiques and the front yard is wonderful. My large family was able to all stay together which we couldn’t have done in a hotel. Jonathan made us feel very welcomed and was available day or night if we needed anything.

As a wedding venue, choosing Bellevue Manor is great for a bride who wants to have total control, be very hands on, and stick to a set budget. I was able to choose my own vendors and decorate how I wanted because there were not set alcohol/meal rules or added on fees like other venues. The house is great for a rehearsal dinner, catered buffet, ceremony, wedding reception, wedding photos, bridal party, and honeymoon suite.

The property accommodated our wedding with 100 guests perfectly. We used the carport for crafting/sorting decorations one night and then hosted a 30 person rehearsal dinner the next. For the wedding, we had our ceremony under the oak tree and then our reception in the front yard, which was enough space for 12 tables, dancing, and a bar. The carport was used for a buffet and our caterer had easy access to the kitchen. The front porch served as a space for the cake table on one side and the DJ on the other. The bridal party was able to get ready upstairs before the wedding. One of the gated fields was used for parking and the semi-circle driveway was very convenient. We also created a honeymoon suite by closing off a few doors, which allowed for a connecting bedroom, living area, and bathroom. There are very large closets inside the house that we used to store all of our suitcases and miscellaneous stuff so that our guest could tour an uncluttered house during reception.The bridal party proceeded out through the front doors and down the sidewalk to the ceremony. The property is large enough that we were able to take bridal party photos while being separated from our guests.

Jonathan was there to help out with whatever we needed, allowed to use things around the house to decorate with, and move things around for the wedding. Jonathan provided us with tiki torches, paper tree lanterns, extra toilet paper, 2 rectangular folding tables, and extra trash bags. He treated the grounds for mosquitoes, prepped the yard, gave us great set up ideas, rented our table cloths, and gave us a table/chair rental company suggestion, let us arrive early, let us leave late, and let us do a walkthrough. I was very hands on with my wedding and brought my own signs, antique decorations, and flowers.

Bellevue Manor was the perfect venue for my wedding to make it stress-free and enjoyable. I highly recommend it.

review_text:
First off, communication with Melissa was great. She's very kind and quick to respond and goes above and beyond with her communication. I travel around Louisiana a lot and have stayed in many small cabins/cottages around the state and this one is my new definite favorite. It's located down a quiet road with neighbors all spread fairly apart (yet VERY convenient to get to town). I loved that privacy. You really feel secluded with a lovely pasture across from the front of the house and a really cool "forest-type" area in the back (where I rode a dirt bike they have available through the trees and the mud and up and down the little hills...definitely a lot of fun). There is a beautiful deck with a gas grill that's overlooks a sloped hill in front of a creek. There is also a screened indoor porch (with a ceiling fan to keep it very tolerable for sitting outside; even in the late June heat). The view from the porch is the same as from the deck and I stayed outside listening to music and grilling and enjoying the view for hours. The house itself was sparkling clean and had a cute design. Although it's not a huge cottage, it feels very spacious due to an open design and it's certainly not what I would call a small house. There is a spacious kitchen with a gas stove and lots of pots and pans and bowls and plates and utensils. It was exactly like being in your own kitchen. There are two bedrooms; so the cabin is perfect for two friends, two couples, parents and two small children or one older child or a solo traveler like myself. Upon arrival, I saw some blueberry muffins that had been left for me along with some personalized notes welcoming me. They also left me fresh vegetables that had just been picked and they told me to enjoy some of the tiny sweet tomatoes growing from a plant on their deck. They also left me homemade granola and yogurt in the refrigerator to enjoy for breakfast.
Please don't let the fact that there is no central air deter you. There are three powerful window units and several ceiling fans that keep the cool air flowing. It was very hot outside when I was there but inside was more than comfortable. Even though there is no cable TV, the stations they do get are crystal clear and there are at least a dozen of them. And even though there is no WIFI, I was able to get internet perfectly on my phone using my own data. I even paired my phone with my iPad and streamed some movies while I relaxed on the porch. This is the perfect place to just settle back and relax and enjoy a beautiful atmosphere with great hospitality from caring hosts. I will definitely be returning again!

The cottage is pretty, very clean, and very, very comfortable. Everything I needed was provided. There was not one bug in sight nor evidence of any bugs at all. I felt safe the entire time. The bed was extremely comfortable to me and the linens were nice and appropriate. Although the cottage was new to me, I felt as though I was home.
There is a little book on the table near the front door where the history of the home is recorded in word and photos and showed the transformation from the owner's grandparents' home into the pretty little jewel it is today.
I felt that the price was reasonable and affordable. The location was good. It was near the interstate so it was easy to get to, but it still felt like country. There are plenty of restaurants nearby as well as a Walmart.
This really was a perfect place to stay and encourage you to book it!

This little barn-cabin is such a special spot that it's hard to convey in words how magical the space is. When you enter the folk art barn, you instantly feel like you've been transported back in time in an extremely pleasant way. Many of the dishes and decorations reminded me of my grandmother's house growing up, and it felt like being at home. The kitchen is especially charming, like Justin Wilson might appear at any moment to film a cooking show (if you're not from around here, Google it and you'll see what I mean!).
The cabin is particularly spacious, and while I came by myself to have a solo getaway, I hope to return next time with several friends in tow. This cabin and the adjacent Folk Art Honky Tonk are both on Jim and Christy's beautiful property. While it's not a completely isolated cabin, I felt like it was just the right mix of off the beaten path but close enough to Jim & Christy's main house in case anything came up.
The only thing about the stay that was more pleasant and charming than the space itself were the wonderful hosts, Jim and Christy! Where to begin... Jim and Christy were extremely gracious and attentive while also giving me plenty of space and privacy. When I arrived after dark and had trouble seeing the driveway at night, Christy came out to the main highway with a flashlight to help me find my way. They left fresh flowers on the kitchen table, brought me fresh okra and a butternut squash from their garden, and gave me a tour of the other buildings on their property that they have lovingly renovated. When I had some car trouble, Jim even went out of his way to help me charge up my car battery. Sometimes you meet people and instantly know they are really, really good folks, and that's how it felt to meet Jim and Christy.
During these times of COVID-19, this is the perfect spot to help you feel like you're on a mini vacation while also safely staying put in one place. While the cabin is a short driving distance away from several interesting parts of Cajun country and other natural settings, I was completely content staying put and enjoying the beauty of the cabin and their beautiful property. This would be a fun place now for a mini getaway with friends, and I hope that after the pandemic, I can come back when they host live music & dancing again in the Honky Tonk next door.

review_text: Incredible setting with spectacular oak trees, but a few issues. The house was very clean, well stocked, and nicely furnished.
